messages.content: pain on right abdomen, nausea and vomiting. what do i have?

It is difficult to determine the exact cause of your symptoms without a medical examination, but you may be experiencing gastritis, which is a type of stomach inflammation or infection. Nausea and vomiting can also be caused by a number of different things, such as a viral or bacterial infection, or even by anxiety or stress. It is possible that you have a viral infection of the stomach, such as the common cold or flu, but it is also possible that you have a more serious stomach problem that requires medical attention. I would recommend seeing a doctor if you are experiencing any of these symptoms, as they can help determine the cause and appropriate treatment.
pain on right abdomen, nausea and vomiting. what's the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis for this symptoms would be gastritis. Gastritis is a condition that affects the lining of the stomach, and can cause symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and discomfort. It is a common cause of stomach ulcers and can also cause other symptoms such as heartburn and indigestion. A doctor can perform a physical examination to determine the severity of the symptoms and the extent of the gastritis, and may recommend medication or other treatment if necessary.

Roquefort is a type of cheese that is commonly consumed in France, and it is a very likely diagnosis for this symptom. Roquefort is made from cow's milk, and it is a common cause of mouth ulcers and other mouth problems. It is also a common cause of pain in the mouth and in the gums, as well as other symptoms. A doctor can perform a physical examination to determine the severity of the symptoms and the extent of the mouth problem, and may recommend medication or other treatment if necessary.
